author: holiman
content:
I am not really arguing, just tried to explain my slight bias towards what appeared to be closest to status quo.

 A non-canon tx, e.g. using wrong empty-encoding for a list, could be sent over the wire. We now explicitly error on it, but previously we didn't. However, it wasn't an issue, both geth and parity (not aleth) would re-encode (thus correcting it) before checking hash/sig. But decode-encode is a pretty good defensive measure to avoid trusting the data received.
